          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

          display: block;

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;

    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    text-decoration: underline;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>asan-win32-release_x64-1032438<span class="line"><!---->asan-win32-release_x64-1032438<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>No sample is provided because the test case cannot be reproduce stably, and it is also easy to find this issue by code review.<span class="line"><!---->No sample is provided because the test case cannot be reproduce stably, and it is also easy to find this issue by code review.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>#Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->#Type of crash<!----></span><br>render         This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<span class="line"><!---->This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<!----></span><br><br>Are we somehow allowing null observers to be added?<span class="line"><!---->Are we somehow allowing null observers to be added?<!----></span><br><br>(mlippautz@, am I misremembering how Oilpan GC works here?)<span class="line"><!---->(mlippautz@, am I misremembering how Oilpan GC works here?)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Your understanding is correct. <span class="line"><!---->Your understanding is correct. <!----></span><br><br>> This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<!----></span><br><br>Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<!----></span><br><br>Anton, any chance this is related to the pointer compression issue where we were not respecting ASANs internal alignment restrictions?         observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">

            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          mr-issue-metadata {

            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

          </aside>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

observer) {<!----></span><br>  observers_.erase(observer);						<<[2]<span class="line"><!---->  observers_.erase(observer);						&lt;&lt;[2]<!----></span><br><br>  if (observers_.IsEmpty())<span         Your understanding is correct. <span class="line"><!---->Your understanding is correct. <!----></span><br><br>> This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<!----></span><br><br>Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<!----></span><br><br>Anton, any chance this is related to the pointer compression issue where we were not respecting ASANs internal alignment restrictions?           Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          andypaicu@chromium.org

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          andypaicu@chromium.org
          
          <br>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<span class="line"><!---->As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code? With DCHECKs enabled we should see iterator invalidation happening for WTF containers.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code? With DCHECKs enabled we should see iterator invalidation happening for WTF containers.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 10<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351672#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by

        observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git 424314c1dd4..3fd23852655 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 424314c1dd4..3fd23852655 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -9,6 +9,9 @@<span class="line"><!---->@@ -9,6 +9,9 @@<!----></span><br> #include "third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_utils.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_utils.h"<!----></span><br> #include "third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permissions.h"<span class="line"><!----> #include "third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permissions.h"<!----></span><br><br>+#include "base/logging.h"<span class="line"><!---->+#include "base/logging.h"<!----></span><br>+#include "base/debug/stack_trace.h"<span class="line"><!---->+#include             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1351672: use-after-poison in blink::PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1351672: use-after-poison in blink::PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        #PATCH<span class="line"><!---->#PATCH<!----></span><br>Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<span class="line"><!---->Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<span class="line"><!---->@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>   status_ = status;<span class="line"><!---->   status_ = status;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>-  for (const auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->-  for (const auto&amp;         observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Really curious what's going on here. WTF iterators are generally aware of delete/empty buckets and would skip over them. <span class="line"><!---->Really curious what's going on here.         After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git             Issue 1351672: use-after-poison in blink::PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1351672: use-after-poison in blink::PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      m.coo...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3239484529" title="m.coo...@gmail.com"><!---->m.coo...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      m.coo...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->m.coo...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Aug 10, 2022, 6:12 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 10, 2022, 6:12 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 10, 2022, 6:12 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">

        #PATCH<span class="line"><!---->#PATCH<!----></span><br>Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<span class="line"><!---->Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<span class="line"><!---->@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>   status_ = status;<span class="line"><!---->   status_ = status;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>-  for (const auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->-  for (const auto&amp; observer : observers_) {<!----></span><br>+  HeapHashSet<WeakMember<Observer>> observers;<span class="line"><!---->+  HeapHashSet&lt;WeakMember&lt;Observer&gt;&gt; observers;<!----></span><br>+  observers.swap(observers_);<span class="line"><!---->+  observers.swap(observers_);<!----></span><br>+  for (const auto& observer : observers) {<span class="line"><!---->+  for (const auto&amp; observer : observers) {<!----></span><br>     if (observer)<span class="line"><!---->     if (observer)<!----></span><br>       observer->OnPermissionStatusChange(status);<span class="line"><!---->       observer-&gt;OnPermissionStatusChange(status);<!----></span><br>     else<span class="line"><!---->     else<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case.         observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        andypaicu: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->andypaicu: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==13856==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==13856==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>asan-win32-release_x64-1032438 <span class="line"><!---->asan-win32-release_x64-1032438 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Canary<span class="line"><!---->Canary<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b         #PATCH<span class="line"><!---->#PATCH<!----></span><br>Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<span class="line"><!---->Swap these sets to prevent concurrent modification.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<span class="line"><!---->index 424314c1dd4..8a7bbc4c912 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<span class="line"><!---->@@ -62,7 +62,9 @@ void PermissionStatusListener::OnPermissionStatusChange(<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>   status_ = status;<span class="line"><!---->   status_ = status;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>-  for (const auto& observer : observers_) {<span class="line"><!---->-  for (const auto&amp; observer : observers) {<!----></span><br>     if (observer)<span class="line"><!---->     if (observer)<!----></span><br>       observer->OnPermissionStatusChange(status);<span class="line"><!---->       observer-&gt;OnPermissionStatusChange(status);<!----></span><br>     else<span class="line"><!---->     else<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case.         observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git         As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<span class="line"><!---->As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code? With DCHECKs enabled we should see iterator invalidation happening for WTF containers.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code?           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351672#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351672#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Aug 12, 2022, 12:30 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git         Your understanding is correct. <span class="line"><!---->Your understanding is correct. <!----></span><br><br>> This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This report looks weird: IIRC, Oilpan automatically removes WeakMembers from a HeapHashSet during GC when the referenced object is no longer live.<!----></span><br><br>Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, and in the case we are currently iterating, we _should_ be keeping all contents of the backing alive strongly and not remove anything.<!----></span><br><br>Anton, any chance this is related to the pointer compression issue where we were not respecting ASANs internal alignment restrictions?         by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351672#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351672#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Aug 12, 2022, 7:54 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          andypaicu@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Untriaged)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          andypaicu@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<span class="line"><!---->As was discussed with Michael offline, GC doesn't shrink the backing automatically in the general case. Alternatively, the user code can clear the WeakMember, so the `else`-branch in the bug description can be taken and the iterator invalidation in the general C++ sense would occur.<!----></span><br><br>Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code? With DCHECKs enabled we should see iterator invalidation happening for WTF containers.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning this to @andypaicu. Could you please make sure to add a test case that would cover the code? With DCHECKs enabled we should see iterator invalidation happening for WTF containers.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<span class="line"><!---->observers_ is used in a very limited context, and non-null pointers are never inserted into it (the only insertion is via AddObserver, which is called from one other class, which passes the value of `this` as the pointer. normally, it's possible that `this` might be null, but that method dereferences `this` so it should not be possible for `this` to be null)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<span class="line"><!---->After some effort, I finally reproduced the problem locally, and it turned out that my initial analysis was incorrect, and the reason was indeed related to pointer compression issue.<!----></span><br>By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-> 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<span class="line"><!---->By adding some debug information output, it is found that the value of "observer-&gt; 000000000000FDE6" is not like a normal pointer, but a value after pointer compression.<!----></span><br>I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<span class="line"><!---->I'm still trying to provide a stable and reproducible POC if possible.<!----></span><br><br>#Debug<span class="line"><!---->#Debug<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/permissions/permission_status_listener.cc<!----></span><br>index           flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
